DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Response Domain Relapse Or Progressive Disease Confirmation Central Reviewer CDISC SDTM Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Response Terminology Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A question which asks if progression or relapse was confirmed by central review that may be based on, but may not be limited to parameters indicated in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Response Domain Relapse Or Progressive Disease Confirmation Central Reviewer
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to tumor response._The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity._Having been established or verified._A single person who critically evaluates and reports on laboratory test results, protocols, or other data.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to tumor response.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to tumor response.

Property.preferredName: Relapse Or Progressive Disease Confirmation Central Reviewer
Property.preferredDefinition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.:Having been established or verified.:A single person who critically evaluates and reports on laboratory test results, protocols, or other data.

Concepts.definition: The return of signs and symptoms of cancer after a period of improvement.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.
A single person who critically evaluates and reports on laboratory test results, protocols, or other data.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Response Terminology Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Response within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
